description:
This rule detects network events that may indicate the use of Tor traffic
to the Internet. Tor is a network protocol that sends traffic through a
series of encrypted tunnels used to conceal a user's location and usage.
Tor may be used by threat actors as an alternate communication pathway to
conceal the actor's identity and avoid detection.
false_positives:
Tor client activity is uncommon in managed enterprise networks but may be common
    in unmanaged or public networks where few security policies apply. Because these ports
    are in the ephemeral range, this rule may false under certain conditions such as when a
    NATed web server replies to a client which has used one of these ports by coincidence.
    In this case, such servers can be excluded if desired.
name: Tor Activity to the Internet
